Nintendo might be the last one actually making a console. Linus and Luke discuss what makes the Switch 2 unique in a sea of hybrid platforms, why Xbox’s naming scheme is a mess, and how Sony's PlayStation identity feels increasingly fuzzy. They also brainstorm what the Switch 3 could look like, and why motion gaming might be due for a comeback.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TWb2P-GGBcU

title: Does console gaming have a future?

Framework and several other tech companies have paused or adjusted US sales due to tariff-related uncertainty. Linus and Luke dig into what this tells us about razor-thin margins in the tech industry, and the broader implications for manufacturing, trade, and pricing in the US. Plus, China’s tariff response and how it's affecting game consoles, laptops, and even MrBeast’s chocolate business.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TWb2P-GGBcU

Is BYOC dead? Linus and Luke revisit Whale LAN and the surprising challenges, and opportunities, they uncovered during their infrastructure test. From power plug mishaps to a full rethink of what the event should be, they discuss pivoting from traditional LANs to something more immersive and arcade-like. Plus, they share exciting ideas like Left 4 Dead tournaments, Star Trek Bridge Crew setups, and even a Red Bull chug jug (which... no). It’s LAN party reimagined, with fewer wires, more fun.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TWb2P-GGBcU
